slides.title: Semantic Tags
slides.content:
# Semantic HTML üèóÔ∏è

Before HTML5, we used a lot of `<div>` tags. HTML5 introduced **semantic tags** that clearly describe their meaning to both the browser and the developer.

## Common Semantic Tags

- `<header>`: Introductory content or nav links
- `<nav>`: Navigation links
- `<main>`: Dominant content of body
- `<section>`: Thematic grouping of content
- `<article>`: Independent, self-contained content
- `<aside>`: Sidebar/related content
- `<footer>>`: Footer area

> üí° **Why?** Improves **SEO** and **Accessibility** (Screen readers understand the layout better).

slides.title: Audio and Video
slides.content:
# Multimedia üé¨

HTML5 makes embedding media native and easy.

## The <video> Element

```html
<video controls width="250">
    <source src="movie.mp4" type="video/mp4">
    Your browser does not support the video tag.
</video>
```

- `controls`: detailed play/pause buttons
- `autoplay`: Starts automatically (often muted)
- `loop`: Repeats forever

## The <audio> Element

```html
<audio controls>
    <source src="music.mp3" type="audio/mpeg">
</audio>
```

slides.title: Canvas and SVG
slides.content:
# Graphics: Canvas & SVG üé®

## <canvas>

Used to draw graphics on the fly via JavaScript (graphs, game graphics).

```html
<canvas id="myCanvas" width="200" height="100"></canvas>
<script>
  var c = document.getElementById("myCanvas");
  var ctx = c.getContext("2d");
  ctx.fillStyle = "red";
  ctx.fillRect(10, 10, 50, 50);
</script>
```

## <svg> (Scalable Vector Graphics)

XML-based vector graphics, scalable without losing quality.

```html
<svg width="100" height="100">
  <circle cx="50" cy="50" r="40" stroke="green" stroke-width="4" fill="yellow" />
</svg>
```
